snippet: In a welcome development, demolishing work began on the Great Works Dam in Maine in an effort to restore ancient fish runs on the Penobscot River.
abstract: Editorial hails the demolition of the Great Works Dam in Bradley, Me, the first step in a multiyear effort to restore ancient fish runs on the Penobscot River; argues that regulators and lawmakers should now search for other opportunities to get rid of unnecessary hydroelectric dams.
lead_paragraph: In a welcome development, demolishing work began on the Great Works Dam in Maine in an effort to restore ancient fish runs on the Penobscot River.

headline.print_headline: Saving a River, and Its Species
headline.seo: Saving a River and Its Species
headline.main: Saving a River, and Its Species
